info.title: AI Agent Framework API
info.description: A comprehensive platform for creating, orchestrating, and deploying AI agents

post.description:
Register a new user.

Creates a new user account with basic user role.

Authenticate user and return access tokens.

Returns JWT access and refresh tokens for authenticated user.

Refresh access token using refresh token.

Returns new access and refresh tokens.

get.description:
Get current user profile information.

Returns the authenticated user's profile data.

put.description:
Update current user profile information.

Allows users to update their own profile data.

post.description:
Change user password.

Requires current password for verification.

Reset user password (admin function).

This is a simplified implementation. In production, this would
require proper authorization and possibly email verification.
Logout user.

get.description: List all users (admin only).

schema.title: Response List Users Api V1 Auth Users Get

post.description:
Create a new user (admin only).

Creates a new user account with specified roles.

get.description: Get user by ID (admin only).

put.description:
Update user details (admin only).

Allows admins to update user information and role assignments.

delete.description:
Delete/deactivate a user (admin only).

Sets the user's is_active flag to False instead of hard delete.

get.description: List all available roles (admin only).

schema.title: Response List Roles Api V1 Auth Roles Get

post.description:
Create a new role (admin only).

Creates a new role with specified permissions.

get.description: Get roles assigned to a user (admin only).

schema.title: Response Get User Roles Api V1 Auth Users  User Id  Roles Get

post.description: Assign a role to a user (admin only).

delete.description: Remove a role from a user (admin only).

put.description:
Update a role (admin only).

Updates role name, description, and/or permissions.

delete.description:
Delete a role (admin only).

Prevents deletion of system roles.

get.description: List all available permissions (admin only).

schema.title: Response List Permissions Api V1 Auth Permissions Get

post.description:
Create a new API key for the current user.

The API key will be returned only once. Make sure to save it securely.

get.description: List all API keys for the current user.
Get details of a specific API key.

put.description: Update an API key's name, description, or permissions.

delete.description: Revoke an API key. This action cannot be undone.

get.description: Get usage statistics for an API key.
List all API keys in the system (admin only).

post.description: Clean up expired API keys (admin only).

post.description:
Create a new chain orchestration workflow.

This endpoint initializes a new chain and its associated nodes and edges.
If no nodes are provided, it automatically creates default START and END nodes.

- **name**: Descriptive name for the chain.
- **nodes**: List of orchestration nodes (optional).
- **edges**: List of connections between nodes (optional).

get.description:
List all orchestration chains with optional filtering.

Returns a lightweight list of chains including metadata like node counts and execution history summary.
Use this endpoint for population chain lists in the UI.

schema.title: Response List Chains Api V1 Chains Get

get.description:
Get full details of a specific chain.

Returns the complete chain configuration, including all nodes, edges, and schemas.
Required for rendering the visual Chain Builder canvas.

put.description:
Update an existing chain configuration.

Supports partial updates of metadata and full replacement of node/edge graphs.
When updating nodes or edges, the existing graph is replaced with the new one.

post.description:
Validate chain structure and configuration.

Checks for cycles, invalid agent references, disconnected nodes, etc.

Execute a chain.

Starts asynchronous execution of the chain with the provided input data.

get.description: Get execution history for a chain.

schema.title: Response Get Chain Executions Api V1 Chains  Chain Id  Executions Get

get.description: Get detailed execution information.
Get quick status of an execution (for polling).

post.description: Cancel a running execution.

get.description: Get logs for an execution.

schema.title: Response Get Execution Logs Api V1 Chains Executions  Execution Id  Logs Get

get.description: Retrieve audit logs with filtering, pagination, and search capabilities.

post.description: Create a custom audit log entry.

schema.title: Response Create Audit Log Audit Logs Post

get.description: Retrieve a specific audit log entry by event ID.
Get audit log statistics and analytics.

post.description: Generate a comprehensive compliance report.

Verify the cryptographic integrity of audit logs.

get.description: Health check endpoint for the audit service.

get.description: Check the health status of an MCP server.
Get list of supported MCP protocols.

Get overall system health status

Returns comprehensive health information including:
- Overall system status
- Individual component health checks
- Performance metrics
- Error details if any

Get health status for a specific component

Args:
    component: Component name (database, redis, system_resources, etc.)

Get Prometheus metrics data

Returns metrics in Prometheus format for scraping
Get historical metrics data from Prometheus

Get active system alerts

Requires authentication to view alerts

post.description:
Acknowledge an alert

Args:
    alert_id: ID of the alert to acknowledge

get.description:
Get current system resource usage

Returns CPU, memory, disk, and network statistics
Get database connection and performance status
Get Redis cache status and performance metrics
Get status of external services (Kong, Keycloak, etc.)
Get status of LLM providers (Ollama, OpenAI, etc.)

Get performance summary with key metrics

Requires authentication to view performance data

Get aggregated dashboard statistics

Returns counts for Agents, Tools, and Workflows
Get Prometheus metrics
Root endpoint for health check.
Health check endpoint.
